pyfrag_plotter.plot package

Submodules

pyfrag_plotter.plot.plot_classes module

class MultiPlotter(plotpath, instances, irc_coord_info: Tuple[str, Dict[str, str]])[source]

Bases: object

check_terms()[source]

Checks if certain keys/terms are present in the data and in EDA keys that should be plotted by returning True (‘yes’) or False (‘no’) for each

get_max_peaklength() → float[source]

Checks which system has the highest peak and return the coordinate corresponding to that peak

plot(interpolate_coord: float | None = None)[source]

Plots graphs such as ASM, EDA, overlaps, populations etc. for all systems combined

plot_multiple_asm(plot_extra_strain=False)[source]

Plots the ASM terms being Ebond, Eint and Estrain

plot_multiple_eda(disp_check)[source]

Plots the EDA terms for each instance in one graph and in seperate graphs

plot_multiple_energygap()[source]

Plots the energy gap for each instance for the same MO pair in seperate graphs Note: it assumes that the number of MO pairs is the same for each instance

plot_multiple_overlap()[source]

Plots the overlap for each instance for the same MO pair in seperate graphs Note: it assumes that the number of MO pairs is the same for each instance

plot_multiple_population()[source]

Plots the gross populations for each instance for the same MO pair in seperate graphs Note: it assumes that the number of MO pairs is the same for each instance

plot_multiple_stabilization()[source]

Plots the stabilization (S^2/gap) of a certain MOpair for each instance Note: it assumes that the number of MO pairs is the same for each instance and that the overlapkey represent the same MO pair as the orbital energy keys

class SoloPlotter(inputfile, resultfile, color, systemname, irc_coord_info: Tuple[str, Dict[str, str]], max_plotstep)[source]

Bases: object

check_disp_term()[source]

Removes the dispersion term in the EDA if its contribution is 0 or near 0

check_terms()[source]

Determines if overlaps, orbitalenergies and/or gross populations have been calculated

create_plotpath(plotpath)[source]

Takes as argument the desired plotpath for the plots If the directory does not exist, it creates one

determine_stationary_point(energy_array)[source]

Determines the step at which a stationary point is reached: either the minimum or maximum of the supplied energy array

get_eda_keys()[source]

Returns a list containing the EDA keys. This method is necessary because the dispersion term could be removed for this instance This method is used in the multiplot class

get_energygap(f1, f2)[source]

Determines the HOMO LUMO gap Takes two keys, present in the datadic, and determines the absolute difference

get_peakinfo(dic=True)[source]
Returns information on the peak step:

dic = True: returns the dictionary containing all the results at the peak position dic = False: returns the step at which the energy peak as been reached

get_specialkey(key: str | None = None)[source]

Returns a dictionary containing the data names of special keys such as ‘overlap’, ‘orbitalenergy’, etc. The user can choose which special key will be returned

get_stabilization(overlapkey, e_key1, e_key2)[source]

Determines the stabilization S^2/gap for a certain MO pair Important: the MO pair in the overlapkey should correspond to the MO pair of the individual orbitalenergy keys Returns the stabilization in units [S^2 / eV]

get_systeminfo()[source]

Returns the name, dictrionary with the data, color and … of the instance This method is used in the multiplot class

plot(plotpath, plotparameter=False)[source]
plot_asm_terms()[source]

Plots the ASM terms in a combined graph

plot_eda_terms()[source]

Plots the EDA terms in either a combined graph or in seperate graphs

plot_energygaps(orb_keys)[source]

Takes as argument the keys which represent the data with the orbital energies Plots the specified energy gaps and saves the figure

plot_overlaps(overlap_keys)[source]

Takes as argument the keys which represent the overlap between two orbitals Plots the specified overlap(s) and saves the figure

plot_populations(pop_keys)[source]

Takes as argument the keys which represent the population of orbitals Plots the specified populations and saves the figure

read_data(datafile: str)[source]

Creates a dictionary with with the keys specifying which data it represents (EDA term, energy, etc.) Takes as argument the absolute path to the pyfrag output file

read_inputfile(inputfile)[source]

Takes as argument the inputfile for the pyfrag calculation Extracts extra specifications such as orbitalenergy, overlap, population of a certain fragment and MO

remove_outliers(data_matrix)[source]

Removes outliers in the data (caused by forcing restricted conditions) The threshold is specified in plot_parameters.py and the outlier is removed when its value is higher than the threshold compared to its neighboring values

set_plot_details(xlabel: str | None = None, ylabel: str | None = None, title: str | None = None, savefig: str | None = None, clear: bool | None = True, ylim: List[float] | None = None, vline: float | None = None, zero_line: bool | None = None)[source]

Function that specifies plot options for making a shorter and cleaner code

switch(value)[source]

Acts as a switch by returning 1 when the value is 0 and vice versa

pyfrag_plotter.plot.plot_details module
